metadata.synopsis: Aradin is yelling to Klank because it is blocking the entrance to the Sorcerous Sundries shop. Aradin asks the player whether they had success on the quest of the nightsong and leaves.LORR-oh-AH-kan.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to aradin in fron of Sorcerous Sundries.209; 24; 436There are two main elements to set before starting sorcerous sundries: set whether Nightsong is alive at camp or dead and add her to camp if she is alive.Debug Book → Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries → Make Nightsong be dead / Make Nightsong be at campTo physically add Nightsong to camp we have to execute Camp Debug Book → Invite People → Invite individuals → Invite NIGHTSONGYou can advance the plot by setting “Make Nightsong wait for dialog at camp” (will have to be at camp first) and “Make Nightsong go final confrontation. Both options are at Debug Book → Set quest flags and options → Sorcerous Sundries →

32.speaker: Aradin
32.text: Let me back in, or bring Lorroakan out here, you tin tube.

42.speaker: Aradin
42.text: You tell Lorroakan I went for his godsdamned Nightsong, and now he has to pay up. What're you looking at?
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: On "What're you looking at?" Aradin notices player and turns to face themNodeContext: First line to Klank, second line to player

50.text: Shit, it's you. You went looking for the Nightsong after me. Please tell me you found it.

53.speaker: Aradin
53.text: Shit, it's you. You went looking for the Nightsong after me. Please tell me you found it.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Who are you trying to get at inside?

24.speaker: Aradin
24.text: Lorroakan - the wizard who set out the contract. He owns this place. And his little pageboy inside knows how to get to him.

19.speaker: Aradin
19.text: Lorroakan said it'd be easy money - a smash and grab. Get in, get the Nightsong, go.

11.speaker: Aradin
11.text: Turns out his little relic was in a temple of Shar, beneath an army of goblins. Would never have taken my people in if I'd known.
11.context: NodeContext: Sadly, through his tough mean exterior. (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

22.speaker: Aradin
22.text: I can't bring 'em back. But I can make Lorroakan cough up. Especially if you found the relic.
22.context: NodeContext: Sadly, through his tough mean exterior. (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

109.speaker: Player
109.context: NodeContext: With threat in his voice

61.speaker: Aradin
61.text: Answer the question. Did you find it or not?
61.context: NodeContext: With threat in his voice

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I found the Nightsong. Turns out it wasn't a relic, but an aasimar.

102.speaker: Aradin
102.text: An aasimar? Hells. If I'd known, I'd have asked for more gold - kidnapping costs more than theft.

104.speaker: Aradin
104.text: Don't forget I'm the one who gave you that contract. I want my cut.
104.context: NodeContext: 'Name of Balduran,' a mild oath

0.speaker: Aradin
0.text: Good luck getting a blue copper out of Lorroakan. Guy's tighter than a blacknose sheep.

75.speaker: Aradin
75.text: You get that money, you come find me. Or I'll come looking for you.

13.speaker: Player
13.context: NodeContext: Second part said as though to Lorroakan in the shop he's trying to enter.

93.speaker: Aradin
93.text: Hope you lost fewer people along the way than I did. Bloody goblins. Lorroakan should've warned us.
93.context: NodeContext: Second part said as though to Lorroakan in the shop he's trying to enter.

39.speaker: Aradin
39.text: Hope you lost fewer people along the way than I did. Bloody goblins. Lorroakan should've warned us.
39.context: NodeContext: Second part said as though to Lorroakan in the shop he's trying to enter.

56.text: You're lying. Can't say I blame you. Thing's worth a fortune.

48.speaker: Aradin
48.text: You're lying. Can't say I blame you. Thing's worth a fortune.

46.speaker: Aradin
46.text: Hope you hid it well, mate.

92.speaker: Aradin
92.text: Maybe. I don't know you, though. And I'd thank you to get out of my face.

66.speaker: Aradin
66.text: Lorroakan. Wizard that owns that shop. Sent me on a wild goose chase into a hive of goblins for some relic. Said it would be an easy take.

15.speaker: Aradin
15.text: I lost good people. Good friends. The 'Nightsong' my arse.

77.speaker: Player
77.context: NodeContext: Very aggro, ready to fight the player.

33.speaker: Aradin
33.context: NodeContext: Very aggro, ready to fight the player.

6.speaker: Aradin
6.text: I've lost good people to the wizard that owns that shop. Lorroakan. Offered a huge pile of cash to chase down some relic called the 'Nightsong'.

97.speaker: Aradin
97.text: If he'd mentioned it was buried under a goblin hive, I'd never have taken my people there. He owes me. A lot.
97.context: NodeContext: On 'an aasimar,' he's surprised, coming to terms with this fact quickly. ('AH-sim-ar')

105.speaker: Player
105.text: What does he want with the Nightsong?
105.context: NodeContext: On 'an aasimar,' he's surprised, coming to terms with this fact quickly. ('AH-sim-ar')

29.speaker: Aradin
29.text: Don't know. Don't care. But he did offer a king's ransom for its return.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I found the Nightsong, actually. Turns out it wasn't a relic, but an aasimar.
26.context: NodeContext: On 'an aasimar,' he's surprised, coming to terms with this fact quickly. ('AH-sim-ar')

45.speaker: Aradin
45.text: An aasimar... you found it?! Where is it?
45.context: NodeContext: On 'an aasimar,' he's surprised, coming to terms with this fact quickly. ('AH-sim-ar')

78.speaker: Player
78.text: She's in my camp. If you want to turn her in, you're going to have to take her down yourself.

101.speaker: Aradin
101.text: Still alive, is she? You better be telling the truth, and you better not get in my way.

70.speaker: Aradin
70.text: Still alive, is she? You better be telling the truth, and you better not get in my way.

40.speaker: Aradin
40.text: I'm not losing any more people. Not any good ones, anyway.

62.speaker: Aradin
62.text: I'll need to see who's around. But with cash like what Lorroakan's offering, I don't think I'll have any trouble recruiting help.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: She's long gone by now. There's no reward to be had.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. Lorroakan wanted her alive - and she's dead.

89.speaker: Aradin
89.text: And I suppose you were stupid enough to kill her?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: She's immortal. And tough. You can forget about turning her in for a reward.

41.speaker: Aradin
41.text: Immortal, eh? Interesting. Won't be easy getting her back to the wizard, but if you don't do it, someone else will.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: She's gone - I'm not sure where to.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: She's gone - I'm not sure where to.

71.speaker: Aradin
71.text: Son of a bastard's whore. You had a small fortune in your grasp, and you let it go?!

17.speaker: Aradin
17.text: Son of a bastard's whore. You had a small fortune in your grasp, and you let it go?!

79.speaker: Aradin
79.text: I ought to knock some sense into you, but you know what? I'm too godsdamn tired.

59.speaker: Aradin
59.text: I gave your boy Helm a shot, you know. Stopped by a shrine of his. Even offered up a copper. And do you know what I got in return? One less copper.

16.speaker: Aradin
16.text: I thought about what you said before, by the way. About Tyr. Wondered if I might've missed a trick, not having a god in my corner.

43.speaker: Aradin
43.text: But then I started to wonder why I'd worship someone who had the power to help people, but chose not to unless they bowed before him. You can't answer me that, can you?

14.speaker: Aradin
14.text: If she's out there, I'm gonna find her. You mark my words.

82.speaker: Aradin
82.text: Sod it. Enough. Lorroakan and his precious Nightsong just about ruined my life. If you value yours, I'd steer well clear of this place.
82.context: NodeContext: Grim and sarcastic on the 'good luck, pal.' (loh-ROW-ah-kun)

96.speaker: Aradin
96.text: I tried praying to your fella Tempus, by the way. Down on my knees and everything. Felt like a fool. Still do.

37.text: How dumb do you think I am? You're hiding her. Can't blame you for wanting the reward for yourself.
37.context: NodeContext: Meancing. He's going to find her.

4.speaker: Aradin
4.text: How dumb do you think I am? You're hiding her. Can't blame you for wanting the reward for yourself.
4.context: NodeContext: Meancing. He's going to find her.

52.speaker: Aradin
52.text: Hope you hid her well, mate.
52.context: NodeContext: Meancing. He's going to find her.

38.text: Only place I'm going is wherever you've got the aasimar stashed.

57.speaker: Aradin
57.text: Only place I'm going is wherever you've got the aasimar stashed.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: To chase the Nightsong is to once more rush into danger - reflect on your past mistakes.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I'm sorry to hear about your friends.

76.speaker: Aradin
76.text: 'Sorry' won't bring 'em back, pay their debts, or compensate me for my trouble.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Last time I saw you, you'd cleaned the clock of a tiefling named Zevlor.

58.speaker: Aradin
58.text: Oh yeah. That prick. You should probably get out of my way unless you want the same treatment.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Last time I saw you, you'd been knocked out by a tiefling named Zevlor.

3.speaker: Aradin
3.text: Guy was a prick. So were you, if memory serves.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Last time I saw you, I'd cleaned your clock.

31.speaker: Aradin
31.text: You're lucky I'm not in the mood for payback.

5.speaker: Aradin
5.text: Why don't you move along before you start regretting hanging around?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Last time I saw you, you almost came to blows with Zevlor back in the druid's grove.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I'm looking at the idiot making all the noise.

2.speaker: Aradin
2.text: I can knock you out if the noise is bothering you.

55.speaker: Aradin
55.text: Should have pounded that rustbucket into scrap as soon as it kicked me out of the shop.

86.speaker: Aradin
86.text: But it won't do me no good. So if you're looking for a 'thank you', look somewhere else.
